Evaluation_Questions: How well did this course, to the extent promised in the syllabus, enable “conversation across lines of difference,” integrate practical and theoretical concerns, or consider and integrate issues of class, gender/sexuality, race/ethnicity, dis/ability, and or global/cultural diversity
Comments_Questions: What was the name of your practicum instructor
What were her/his strengths or weaknesses
Comments_List: Ned was a wonderful teacher. His choice of music for me was thoughtful and reflected the unique goals and needs of my voice. He offered me clear and consistent feedback about how to grow vocally, and gave me excellent tools for moving forward with my practice.
He was always encouraging and offered constructive feedback,

PURE GOLD: thank you, Simon, for your optimism, skills/strengths, and encouragement.  Weekly lessons were not abusive or stressful (sorry, this has happened before in other instruments prior to YDS in my own background) and abundant in helpful observations, suggestions, and useful exercises.

Simon is going far.  Thank you YDS for bringing him her among us this year.

Simon is a very patient person which is essential in trying to teach me how to sing. He is enthusiastic and encouraging. I feel that I made real progress over the semester. This was the most enjoyable part of the class.
